results.headline: ‘The Nightingale’ Review: A Song of Violence and Vengeance
results.summary_short: Jennifer Kent follows “The Babadook” with a harrowing, politically charged tale of sexual and racial brutality in 19th-century Tasmania.

results.headline: ‘Luce’ Review: A Star Student Tests His Teacher’s Limits
results.summary_short: To say that this feature unfolds like a play is both accurate and undersells just how gorgeously it has been rendered for the screen.

results.headline: ‘Hobbs & Shaw’ Review: Rock-em-Sock-em Bromance

results.headline: ‘La Flor’ Review: Four Women in Search of a Movie
results.summary_short: Mariano Llinás’s 13-hour cinematic puzzle is a labor of love and obsession.

results.headline: ‘The Son’ Review: She’s Having a Baby (Without You)
results.summary_short: Where “Rosemary’s Baby” preyed on a mother’s loss of agency over her child, this Argentine thriller toys with a father’s utter superfluousness.

results.headline: ‘Tel Aviv on Fire’ Review: Mideast Conflict as Soap Opera and Farce
results.summary_short: Sameh Zoabi’s new film is less incendiary, and quite a bit funnier, than its title might suggest.

results.headline: ‘The Operative’ Review: High on Espionage, Low on Surprise
results.summary_short: A bit of suspense and a good Diane Kruger performance notwithstanding, this thriller doesn’t have much new to offer.

results.headline: ‘Piranhas’ Review: Junior Mafia

results.headline: ‘Ladyworld’ Review: Fresh Talents Prove Themselves in a Twist on ‘Lord of the Flies’

results.headline: ‘A Score to Settle’ Review: Vengeance Is Fine

results.headline: ‘Boi’ Review: Being Driven to Distraction

results.headline: ‘The Mountain’ Review: Dutiful Minds

results.headline: ‘Jirga’ Review: A Soldier Returns to the Scene of His War Crime

results.headline: ‘Mike Wallace Is Here’ Review: A Ticktock of a Newsman’s Life

results.headline: ‘Skin’ Review: Divide and Prejudice
